channel.title: stable on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in stable on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Linux Doas Conf File Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of doas.conf file in linux host platform.

item.title: Linux Doas Tool Execution
item.description: Detects the doas tool execution in linux host platform.

item.title: Linux Crypto Mining Pool Connections
item.description: Detects process connections to a Monero crypto mining pool

item.title: Windows Crypto Mining Indicators
item.description: Detects command line parameters or strings often used by crypto miners

item.title: Windows Crypto Mining Pool Connections
item.description: Detects process connections to a Monero crypto mining pool

item.title: Monero Crypto Coin Mining Pool Lookup
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries to Monero mining pools

item.title: OMIGOD HTTP No Authentication RCE
item.description: Detects the exploitation of OMIGOD (CVE-2021-38647) which allows remote execute (RCE) commands as root with just a single unauthenticated HTTP request. Verify, successful, exploitation by viewing the HTTP client (request) body to see what was passed to the server (using PCAP). Within the client body is where the code execution would occur. Additionally, check the endpoint logs to see if suspicious commands or activity occurred within the timeframe of this HTTP request.

item.title: Possible PrintNightmare Print Driver Install
item.description: Detects the remote installation of a print driver which is possible indication of the exploitation of PrintNightmare (CVE-2021-1675). The occurrence of print drivers being installed remotely via RPC functions should be rare, as print drivers are normally installed locally and or through group policy.

item.title: Windows Defender Exclusions Added
item.description: Detects the Setting of Windows Defender Exclusions

item.title: Suspicious Spool Service Child Process
item.description: Detects suspicious print spool service (spoolsv.exe) child processes.

item.title: Pulse Connect Secure RCE Attack CVE-2021-22893
item.description: This rule detects exploitation attempts using Pulse Connect Secure(PCS) vulnerability (CVE-2021-22893)

item.title: AWS EC2 Disable EBS Encryption
item.description: Identifies disabling of default Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) encryption in the current region. Disabling default encryption does not change the encryption status of your existing volumes.

item.title: AWS SecurityHub Findings Evasion
item.description: Detects the modification of the findings on SecurityHub.

item.title: Windows Defender AMSI Trigger Detected
item.description: Detects triggering of AMSI by Windows Defender.

item.title: Winnti Pipemon Characteristics
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Winnti Pipemon malware reported by ESET

item.title: Windows Defender Threat Detected
item.description: Detects all actions taken by Windows Defender malware detection engines

item.title: Windows Defender Threat Detection Disabled
item.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender threat protection

item.title: Remote File Copy
item.description: Detects the use of tools that copy files from or to remote systems

item.title: Cleartext Protocol Usage
item.description: Ensure that all account usernames and authentication credentials are transmitted across networks using encrypted channels. Ensure that an encryption is used for all sensitive information in transit. Ensure that an encrypted channels is used for all administrative account access.

item.title: Cleartext Protocol Usage
item.description: Ensure that all account usernames and authentication credentials are transmitted across networks using encrypted channels. Ensure that an encryption is used for all sensitive information in transit. Ensure that an encrypted channels is used for all administrative account access.

item.title: Default Credentials Usage
item.description: Before deploying any new asset, change all default passwords to have values consistent with administrative level accounts. Sigma detects default credentials usage. Sigma for Qualys vulnerability scanner. Scan type - Vulnerability Management.

item.title: Group Modification Logging
item.description: Configure systems to issue a log entry and alert when an account is added to or removed from any group assigned administrative privileges. Sigma detects\ \ Event ID 4728 indicates a \u2018Member is added to a Security Group\u2019. Event ID 4729 indicates a \u2018Member is removed from a Security enabled-group\u2019\ . Event ID 4730 indicates a\u2018Security Group is deleted\u2019. The case is not applicable for Unix OS. Supported OS - Windows 2008 R2 and 7, Windows 2012 R2\ \ and 8.1, Windows 2016 and 10 Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2000, Windows 2003 and XP.

item.title: Host Without Firewall
item.description: Host Without Firewall. Alert means not complied. Sigma for Qualys vulnerability scanner. Scan type - Vulnerability Management.

item.title: Locked Workstation
item.description: Automatically lock workstation sessions after a standard period of inactivity. The case is not applicable for Unix OS. Supported OS - Windows 2008 R2 and 7, Windows 2012 R2 and 8.1, Windows 2016 and 10 Windows Server 2019.

item.title: DTRACK Process Creation
item.description: Detects specific process parameters as seen in DTRACK infections

item.title: Windows Network Enumeration
item.description: Identifies attempts to enumerate hosts in a network using the built-in Windows net.exe tool.

item.title: Overwriting the File with Dev Zero or Null
item.description: Detects overwriting (effectively wiping/deleting) of a file.

item.title: Suspicious Call by Ordinal
item.description: Detects suspicious calls of DLLs in rundll32.dll exports by ordinal

item.title: Suspicious Double Extension
item.description: Detects suspicious use of an .exe extension after a non-executable file extension like .pdf.exe, a set of spaces or underlines to cloak the executable file in spear phishing campaigns

item.title: Mimikatz through Windows Remote Management
item.description: Detects usage of mimikatz through WinRM protocol by monitoring access to lsass process by wsmprovhost.exe.

item.title: CMSTP UAC Bypass via COM Object Access
item.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects (e.g. UACMe ID of 41, 43, 58 or 65)

item.title: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Shellcode
item.description: Detects Base64 encoded Shellcode

item.title: Rubeus Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Rubeus hack tool

item.title: Suspicious Use of Procdump on LSASS
item.description: Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process. This way we’re also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.

item.title: CMSTP Execution Process Access
item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.title: CMSTP Execution Process Creation
item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.title: CMSTP Execution Registry Event
item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.title: Exploit for CVE-2015-1641
item.description: Detects Winword starting uncommon sub process MicroScMgmt.exe as used in exploits for CVE-2015-1641

item.title: Equation Group DLL_U Load
item.description: Detects a specific tool and export used by EquationGroup

item.title: Python SQL Exceptions
item.description: Generic rule for SQL exceptions in Python according to PEP 249

item.title: User Added to Local Administrators
item.description: This rule triggers on user accounts that are added to the local Administrators group, which could be legitimate activity or a sign of privilege escalation activity

item.title: Multiple Modsecurity Blocks
item.description: Detects multiple blocks by the mod_security module (Web Application Firewall)

item.title: Addition of SID History to Active Directory Object
item.description: An attacker can use the SID history attribute to gain additional privileges.

item.title: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account
item.description: The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers. Attackers may change the password to gain persistence.

item.title: Password Dumper Remote Thread in LSASS
item.description: Detects password dumper activity by monitoring remote thread creation EventID 8 in combination with the lsass.exe process as TargetImage. The process in field Process is the malicious program. A single execution can lead to hundreds of events.

item.title: Addition of Domain Trusts
item.description: Addition of domains is seldom and should be verified for legitimacy.

item.title: Antivirus PrinterNightmare CVE-2021-34527 Exploit Detection
item.description: Detects the suspicious file that is created from PoC code against Windows Print Spooler Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2021-34527 (PrinterNightmare), CVE-2021-1675 .

item.title: Buffer Overflow Attempts
item.description: Detects buffer overflow attempts in Unix system log files

item.title: Clear Linux Logs
item.description: Detects clear logs

item.title: CrackMapExec Command Execution
item.description: Detect various execution methods of the CrackMapExec pentesting framework

item.title: Credential Dumping by LaZagne
item.description: Detects LSASS process access by LaZagne for credential dumping.

item.title: CVE-2021-26857 Exchange Exploitation
item.description: Detects possible successful exploitation for vulnerability described in CVE-2021-26857 by looking for | abnormal subprocesses spawning by Exchange Server’s Unified Messaging service

item.title: Delete Volume Shadow Copies Via WMI With PowerShell
item.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities via PowerShell

item.title: Django Framework Exceptions
item.description: Detects suspicious Django web application framework exceptions that could indicate exploitation attempts

item.title: Failed Code Integrity Checks
item.description: Code integrity failures may indicate tampered executables.

item.title: File Deletion
item.description: Detects file deletion commands

item.title: Impacket Lateralization Detection
item.description: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework

item.title: Login with WMI
item.description: Detection of logins performed with WMI

item.title: Microsoft Defender Tamper Protection Trigger
item.description: Detects block of attempt to disable real time protection of Microsoft Defender by tamper protection

item.title: Password Policy Discovery
item.description: Detects password policy discovery commands

item.title: Process Discovery
item.description: Detects process discovery commands

item.title: Relevant ClamAV Message
item.description: Detects relevant ClamAV messages

item.title: Ruby on Rails Framework Exceptions
item.description: Detects suspicious Ruby on Rails exceptions that could indicate exploitation attempts

item.title: Scheduled Task/Job At
item.description: Detects the use of at/atd

item.title: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities
item.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities

item.title: Spring Framework Exceptions
item.description: Detects suspicious Spring framework exceptions that could indicate exploitation attempts

item.title: System Information Discovery
item.description: Detects system information discovery commands

item.title: TropicTrooper Campaign November 2018
item.description: Detects TropicTrooper activity, an actor who targeted high-profile organizations in the energy and food and beverage sectors in Asia

item.title: Unidentified Attacker November 2018
item.description: A sigma rule detecting an unidetefied attacker who used phishing emails to target high profile orgs on November 2018. The Actor shares some TTPs with YYTRIUM/APT29 campaign in 2016.

item.title: Ursnif Malware C2 URL Pattern
item.description: Detects Ursnif C2 traffic.

item.title: Ursnif Malware Download URL Pattern
item.description: Detects download of Ursnif malware done by dropper documents.

item.title: Zerologon Exploitation Using Well-known Tools
item.description: This rule is designed to detect attempts to exploit Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472) vulnerability using mimikatz zerologon module or other exploits from machine with “kali” hostname.
